text:
Before I found this slack channel, I've already searched forums and read that docs back and forth and there was no mentioning on how to achieve that out of the box. Then I found this slack channel hoping someone have solved that pattern in a real-world application and not just someone who "read" the docs.

Do you even understand the question and the docs you were reading?

For those who are looking, this is still not supported out of the box by "cms-react" at the time of writing

<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C04AY1H2204/p1676997345529019?thread_ts=1676996924.934419&cid=C04AY1H2204>

Hi all, I am stuck with setting up HubSpot in a monorepo project. When deploying it doesn't resolve alias paths and tries to install from a private npm registry. Are there any docs or examples on how to set this up?  Seems like the vite.config.ts in our project is ignored

You are asking if you can put a Form or other HubSpot components inside Islands. Yes that is possible. Now it seems you changed your use case?

You can pass props down from the server to your Islands as well. Not sure about React Nodes since I havenâ€™t tried that out. But you asked if you could wrap existing HubSpot modules, and yes that is possible
